bug.author: jke513
bug.summary: [BUG] Installation error due to Horovod on JLSE
bug.description:
Describe the bug Deephyper building error using pip or from github: horovod, mpi4py
mpi4py can be installed by conda install -c anaconda mpi4py I referred from https://deephyper.readthedocs.io/en/latest/install/local.html#user-installation
To Reproduce Steps to reproduce the behavior:
conda create --name dh python=3.7 conda activate dh pip install deephyper
Expected behavior installing deephyper on Argonne nodes Screenshots <denchmark-code> Building wheel for horovod (setup.py) ... error ERROR: Command errored out with exit status 1: command: comments.comment:
Hello <denchmark-link:https://github.com/jke513>@jke513</denchmark-link> , It looks like MPI is not installed in your environment I looked on the website <denchmark-link:https://press3.mcs.anl.gov/jlse/installed-software/>https://press3.mcs.anl.gov/jlse/installed-software/</denchmark-link>
and found the following information for MPICH Try to add them to your and then re-install DeepHyper export PATH=$PATH:/soft/libraries/mpi/mpich-gcc-3.1.4/bin:$PATH export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=$LD_LIBRARY_PATH:/soft/libraries/mpi/mpich-gcc-3.1.4/lib after adding them to your .bashrc reload source ~/.bashrc or open a new session.

Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Deathn0t>@Deathn0t</denchmark-link> , Thank you for your reply. Unfortunately, adding MPI didn't work. I got the same error. <denchmark-code>(base) [jkoo@jlselogin2 deephyper]$ echo $PATH /home/jkoo/anaconda3/bin:/home/jkoo/anaconda3/condabin:/usr/share/Modules/bin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/bin:/usr/local/sbin:/usr/sbin:/usr/lpp/mmfs/bin:/soft/libraries/mpi/mpich-gcc-3.1.4/bin:/home/jkoo/anaconda3/bin:/home/jkoo/anaconda3/condabin:/usr/share/Modules/bin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/bin:/usr/local/sbin:/usr/sbin:/usr/lpp/mmfs/bin:/home/jkoo/.local/bin:/home/jkoo/bin (base) [jkoo@jlselogin2 deephyper]$ echo $LD_LIBRARY_PATH :/soft/libraries/mpi/mpich-gcc-3.1.4/lib </denchmark-code>
I am trying to install tensorflow-gpu, and it looks like installing horovod with gpu requires several steps from the horovod web <denchmark-link:url>https://github.com/horovod/horovod#install</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:url>https://github.com/horovod/horovod/blob/master/docs/conda.rst</denchmark-link> . works for horovod cpu though. May I ask some questions?
horovod is not required for tensorflow on cpu? For deephyper with gpu tensorflow, is DH_GPU=true pip install -e . only required, and then this will configure all the dependencies? Which horovod version is used for building the current version of deephyper? (Possibly, the old version of horovod can be specified when building deephyper.)

From your home directory install miniconda: wget https://repo.anaconda.com/miniconda/Miniconda3-latest-Linux-x86_64.sh -O ~/miniconda.sh chmod +x miniconda.sh ./miniconda.sh -b -p ~/miniconda3 Then create a dh-env conda environment: conda create -n dh-env python=3.7 conda activate dh-env To verify that these previous steps worked well, run which python and verify that the path corresponds to the dh-env. Then add MPI to your shell (.bashrc or .zshrc etc...): export PATH=$PATH:/soft/libraries/mpi/mpich-gcc-3.1.4/bin:$PATH export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=$LD_LIBRARY_PATH:/soft/libraries/mpi/mpich-gcc-3.1.4/lib Then add CUDA to your shell (.bashrc or .zshrc etc...): export PATH=$PATH:/soft/compilers/cuda-7.0.28/bin:$PATH export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=$LD_LIBRARY_PATH:/soft/compilers/cuda-7.0.28/lib Re-start your session or source .zshrc or source .bashrc. Then install DeepHyper: conda install gxx_linux-64 gcc_linux-64 pip install tensorflow-gpu==1.15 pip install horovod git clone https://github.com/deephyper/deephyper.git cd deephyper/ DH_GPU=true pip install -e . I did not try to execute the software but the installation worked.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/Deathn0t>@Deathn0t</denchmark-link> , Your instruction worked for me. I successfully installed it and tested a running example; I changed some lines for tensorflow-gpu and keras working. I am attaching my installation flow. Build deepyhyer with conda 4.8.4 on JLSE <denchmark-code>conda create -n dh-env python=3.7 conda activate dh-env </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-code>export PATH=$PATH:/soft/libraries/mpi/mpich-gcc-3.1.4/bin:$PATH export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=$LD_LIBRARY_PATH:/soft/libraries/mpi/mpich-gcc-3.1.4/lib </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-code>conda install gxx_linux-64 gcc_linux-64 conda install -c anaconda cudatoolkit=10.0 conda install -c anaconda cudnn pip install tensorflow-gpu==1.15 keras==2.3.1 ipython matplotlib pip install horovod git clone https://github.com/deephyper/deephyper.git cd deephyper/ DH_GPU=true pip install -e . </denchmark-code>
